text: Češnjica (; in older sources also Češnjice,Leksikon občin kraljestev in dežel zastopanih v državnem zboru, vol. 6: Kranjsko. 1906. Vienna: C. Kr. Dvorna in Državna Tiskarna, p. 106.Intelligenzblatt zur Laibacher Zeitung, no. 141. 24 November 1849, p. 21. ) is a settlement in central Slovenia. It lies in the hills east of the capital Ljubljana and belongs to the Ljubljana Urban Municipality. It was part of the traditional region of Lower Carniola and is now included with the rest of the municipality in the Central Slovenia Statistical Region.Ljubljana Municipality site ==Name== The name Češnjica is shared with several other places in Slovenia. It is derived from the common noun češnja 'wild cherry', thus referring to the local vegetation. In the local dialect it is known as Češnjice.Savnik, Roman, ed. 1971. Krajevni leksikon Slovenije, vol. 2. Ljubljana: Državna založba Slovenije, p. 360. In the past the German name was Tscheschenze. ==References== ==External links== * *Češnjica on Geopedia Category:Populated places in the City Municipality of Ljubljana Category:Sostro District
title: Češnjica, Ljubljana
